raw_comment:
1.I notice up to 15 million gigawatt hours, takes up from fossil fuel, with majority being coal and gas, while little being oil. Clean gigawatts start from 10 to 30 million gigawatt hours, with most being taken up from Nuclear and Hydroelectric energy, with little being from wind turbines. 

2.I wonder how the graph will be affected in the future, will there be more fossil fuel or clean energy generation? I also wonder how both types of energy deeply affect our atmosphere and our ecosystem. 

3.This relates to my community as where I live, there are many factories letting out smoke (fossil fuel) which damages the Earth and my community, as my town needs more clean energy. 

4.Clean vs. Fossil electric generation, and it's effects
ace_sentences: Fossil-fuel electricity generation is up to 15 million gigawatt-hours.
Coal and gas are most of this fossil-fuel electricity generation.
Oil is a small part of this fossil-fuel electricity generation.
Clean electricity generation is from 10 million gigawatt-hours to 30 million gigawatt-hours.
Nuclear energy and hydroelectric energy are most of this clean electricity generation.
Wind turbines are a small part of this clean electricity generation.
I wonder how the graph will change in the future.
I wonder if fossil-fuel electricity generation will increase in the future.
I wonder if clean electricity generation will increase in the future.
I wonder how fossil-fuel energy affects the atmosphere.
I wonder how clean energy affects the atmosphere.
I wonder how fossil-fuel energy affects the ecosystem.
I wonder how clean energy affects the ecosystem.
I live in a town.
There are many factories in my town.
The factories emit smoke.
The smoke comes from fossil fuels.
The smoke damages the Earth.
The smoke damages my community.
My town needs more clean energy.
The headline is: Clean vs. fossil electric generation and its effects.
